reviews.review: This game is fun game when you play with friend or alone this game will be better with no bug totally enjoy with it ; )

I've played this game for awhile and can say the devs favor killers. Over the years they have slowly taken away every useful item or perk ability for survivors. The most recent being taking away the insta heal. It makes no sense for the killer to be able to insta down, as well as use a mori to insta kill a survivor while the survivors continue to have less and less to counter the killers side of things.

Favorite game on PC atm, I have spent many hours playing it and there is always more to learn and improve on. If you love getting scared and having your adrenaline rushing through your body, this is the game. DO NOT give up or stop playing it because you lose. By keeping on playing is how you get better.

they have taken my family hostage
Fun game. For an FPS player, it's a way to relax and have fun without holding your mouse down to control your recoil.

Edit: Although I'm back after a 7 month break, I still stand by what I previously said

-Why I'm leaving Dead by Daylight and why you shouldn't get this game-

    Although I can admit that I have had fun times while playing this game, it was ultimately not worth putting any of my time in, let alone 1.5k+ hours, nor was it worth spending hundreds of dollars on cosmetics to support a game that I saw potential in and believed it'd become something great. 


    This game has insane, game-breaking balance issues. This has been a problem since the game's release, and it has improved a ton since then, but the Devs have been taking their sweet time making balance changes that should have happened years ago. Things such as keys, Mori's, and op ultra-rare add-ons are the most common examples.


    The Devs are out of touch and don't know what is good for the future of this game, it appears like they're promoting hiding from the killer over the chase interaction between killer and survivor, which is the whole fun part of the game for both parties. I'm not even sure if they know what THEY want for this game let alone the community.


    They've been releasing killers that ignore the survivor's skill in a chase (Good examples are Spirit and Deathslinger), which is dumb whether or not they do good in the 4v1 situation. They've been creating garbage maps, with the most recent one being Midwich Elementary School, which they accomplished to make extremely unfun to both killer and survivor, with the killer having no way to cut the survivor off so the survivor can just hold 'W' in the right situation, and the survivor side gets crap unsafe pallets in dead-end rooms so there's nothing they can do half the time.


    This game can get extremely stale. Many of us have had the exact same game mode for thousands of hours, with nothing but the odd event to change things up a minor amount. On top of that, the meta perks almost never change so you're stuck with a small set of perks to choose from because so many of them are basically useless, to the point where you have to throw the game to use mettle of man.


    Survivors can literally do gens so fast the killer is completely helpless, at the beginning of the game all 4 survivors can be on gens immediately, with the killer having to find them, down them and unless they are playing a broken killer, get lucky, or the survivor(s) is dog, at least 60% of the survivors objective will be complete.


    And after all of this, they want to add an MMR ranking system! The Devs think they can accomplish a ranking system that means something in a game with such major issues.


In all of this, I didn't even mention that they're nerfing the arguably most balanced killer in the game, Hillbilly, whose base power needed no change whatsoever.

I didn't get to everything, but I like to think that I generally covered many of the main issues of this game, and to justify why I just can't play this game anymore. I hope one day this game will be fixed to the extent where I can get myself to play it again without torturing myself.

Honestly really fun I think allthough the community is bad sometimes as well as the game being buggy to hell I love it and I think if you wanna sink time into a game go ahead with this one. warning it might piss you off (even after 667 hours I still think it's good)

(edit: This man lies this game sucks ass)

Pros:
a) not nearly as toxic as it was
b) plenty of content/characters to choose from

cons:
a) dedicated servers are way too inconsistent for me to recommend the game. I've had multiple matches where the game will lag for both survivors and killer, and just recently had a game where it disconnected me right at the end of the match, screwing me out of my offering, add-ons, and points. The game can be fun at times, but there are still way too many toxic players and servers are way too bad, to the point that you'll have at least 3 bad games in one sitting for either reason.

There are times when servers are consistent and survivors and killers are fun to play with, but the game is too inconsistent for a thumbs up.

I prefer to play killers over the survivors. The survivors require a high skill to play correctly. i will give them more of a go later on. the different builds you can do are what excites me. Worth getting i picked this up on sale for ¬£8 and was worth it. I pop in now and and again spend a few hours playing and i'msatisfied.
